text: William Moulton Marston (May 9, 1893 - May 2, 1947), also known by the pen name Charles Moulton () was an American psychologist and comic book writer. He invented an early version of the lie detector. He was also known as a self- help author and comic book writer who created the character Wonder Woman. ==References== Category:1893 births Category:1947 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in New York (state) Category:American psychologists Category:Wonder Woman Category:American comics writers Category:American inventors Category:Scientists from Massachusetts Category:Writers from Massachusetts Category:Businesspeople from Massachusetts
title: William Moulton Marston
